So notch has tweeted about KSP a few times, along with a yogscast member. These events caused a lot of new members, good and bad. Some stayed, and some left, but it overall improved KSP\'s fan base.

Yesterday, Notch finally officially revealed his new game, '0x10^c'. Yes. That\'s the name. he registered the domain: www.0x10c.com

Obviously this name doesn\'t roll off the tongue if you pronounce 'zero \'x\' ten to the see'. But notch hasn\'t mentioned the 'correct' way to say it.

The 'problem' is that this is a space game. Where you are in an alternate universe, where you can 'Seamlessly [land] on planets.' If we\'ve learned anything form minecraft, It\'s that nobody for the rest of our life will be able to make a sand'box'-style game without being accused of 'copying minecraft.' (terraria, et al)

Well, I feel like I\'m writing a paper with all the quotes and citations, so feel free to discuss more casually about 0x10^c
Looks pretty interesting. Like a cross between KSP and EVE?

The game is still very early in development, but here is a list of things we hope to include:

Hard science fiction.

Lots of engineering.

Fully working computer system.

Space battles against the AI or other players.

Abandoned ships full of loot.

Duct tape!

Seamlessly landing on planets.

Advanced economy system.

Random encounters.

Mining, trading, and looting.

Single and multi player connected via the multiverse.

Bolded are similarities to KSP, the rest seems different but nevertheless extremely enticing, at least to me.
